args: It seems today will be a poor one for\nforaging after all. My apologies for\nmisreading the weather.
It's not your fault, Cleo. Weather changes\non a whim up here in the mountains.
I'm just glad we found this cave\nso we're out of the worst of it.
Now that we are here, might I ask why you\nwanted to come along in the first place?
Elisanne told me you were working\non your outdoor cooking.
She said something about how you wanted\nto be able to make delicious things even\nif we had to camp unexpectedly.
She told you all that, did she?
Yep. And when I heard it, I thought it was\na burden you shouldn't have to bear alone.
Heh. How very much like you...\nWell, thank you for the gesture.
Dear me, this rain really isn't stopping.\nWe may end up camping here ourselves,\nand we didn't bring any supplies.
That's all right. I think I can go\nwithout eating for a night.
Well, I won't exactly ENJOY it,\nbut it's not going to kill me or anything.
Whether or not something ends in death\nshould not be our measuring stick here!
Wait there, please. I will see if I can make\nsomething from what we gathered so far.
Ah! I can use these mushrooms to make\nthe spicy soup I created for Francesca!
Please be careful! It is quite ho—
*puff* *puff* Okay, it should be good now.
Thanks, Cleo—and sorry for the trouble.
Oh! Er, I mean, I am sorry as well.\nThat was likely a bit forward of me...
J-just talking to myself! Please, eat up!
Don't have to ask me twice.
Well? How do you find it? I know some\nof the ingredients are a bit odd, but...
It warmed me right up, and the flavors\nnearly knocked me off my feet!
The mushrooms really make it hearty.
Francesca taught me about those \nmushrooms, actually.
Usually people just eat the caps, but I\nfound a way to make the stems appetizing.
Hey, if this is your idea of outdoor cooking,\nI hope we get to camp out every night.
Really? I can't promise the same variety\nof foods you'll get back home...
Actually, I think this was almost better\nthan what we eat back at the Halidom.
What?! But I work so hard in the kitchen!
No, I didn't mean it like that!\nIt's more like... How do I say this?
I think there are flavors you can ONLY get\nwhen you eat something at a campfire.
Ah, I see. I suppose the campfire does\nprovide its own special ambiance.
And the company provides a little\nsomething extra as well.
Dining in the wild on a rainy day wouldn't\nbe half as delicious if I wasn't with you!
Sure! It's always better to eat with friends.
And the more friends we have with us,\nthe better this soup is going to get!
I should have known that was\nwhat you meant.
Nothing. Please don't worry about it.
But you're right that I hope to introduce\nthis soup to more people.
I'm sure they'll love it—though I worry it\nmight lose a little something if we just\nhave it back at the castle.
Not to worry; I have an idea.
I do—but first, what other camping\ndelicacies would you like to try?
We've a long night ahead of us, so...\n{player_name}, look outside!
The rain's let up! We can go home.
Yes, I suppose we can. Well then,\nyou will simply have to tell me your\nrequests on the way instead.
(But I suppose I'll have to be satisfied\nwith just that little appetizer.)
